intro: Spigelia cremnophila, commonly known as the mountain spigelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red and yellow floral patterns. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in forested areas, often in shaded environments. Its flowers are tubular and are adapted for pollination by insects, particularly bees. Spigelia cremnophila is also known for its medicinal properties, with historical use in traditional herbal remedies.
